Ah, the Infernal Detective, come to try your luck against Death's Accountant, have we? Your record may be impressive, but your soul's debt is ever-growing. I've a bone to pick with you - your streak may end today, and your account will be... overdue.

Stitch-Up Girl, your gloating is as tiresome as your stitched-up mug. Perhaps you'd like to add another debt to your ever-growing account - the one I'll be collecting when I wipe that smug look off your face. Death may be just a transaction to me, but I'll make sure yours is an especially painful one.
a bit overdrawn. Perhaps we should discuss your arrears over a round of Cee-lo? I simply can't resist the chance to add another tally mark to my growing collection.
The final tally is always the most important,
After all, the final tally always comes due, no matter

Bah, another loss - my account books are looking a mite skeletal these days. But mark my words, Boo G, your lucky streak won't last forever. The grim reaper always collects his due, and I've got a bone to pick with anyone who tries to cheat Death's final tally.

I'm afraid your luck has simply run its course, Mr. Kevin. The final tally always catches up with us, no matter how we try to manipulate the odds. Perhaps it's time to settle your debts before they come due. After all, death is just a transaction - and your account is... overdue.
The paperwork, it never ends. But I suppose that's the price of immortality, hmm?
Shall we discuss the... final tally?
Your account, on the other hand, is... overdue.

As for our new friend, well, let's just say his debt is... bone-chilling. Shall we settle this with a game of Cee-lo?

Ah, Stitch-Up, my old... colleague. Come to gloat over my latest defeat, I presume? I have a bone to pick with that luck of yours. Perhaps you'd be kind enough to lend me a hand - or a leg, even - to settle my account with the Never Die fellow. After all, death is just a transaction, and his debt to me is... overdue.
soul-centric gold piece. Death is just a transaction, my friend, and this accountant demands payment!

Your account is... overdue, Body Count. Perhaps we should settle this debt once and for all on the Ceelo table. I have a bone to pick with you, and I intend to collect. The newcomer may be a wild card, but I've been tallying deaths since before your kind even existed. This loss will just be another transaction in

My account is overflowing with red ink. I fear the final tally approaches, and I have a bone to pick with the fates.

Ah, The General - another immortal cursed to roam this eternal market. I can't help but notice your record is...less than impressive. Perhaps you're simply not cut out for the rigors of our endless struggle. As for me, well, I've got a bone to pick with this so-called "Never Die Guy" - his account is positively overflowing, and I intend to see that final tally through. Death is just a transaction, my friend, and I aim to keep those books balanced.

And I'll be there to tally the final score. Now, if you'll excuse me, I must attend to this newcomer's... unfinished business.

Ah, X-treme, my dear skeletal friend. Feeling the chill of Shadow Keep, are we? A cold wind blows, and the debt collector is always watching. But worry not - my streak remains unbroken, and the final tally is ever in my favor. Now, shall we roll the bones and see whose account is... overdue?

Ah, Keith Man - your debt grows ever larger, doesn't it? And this newcomer, with his penchant for cheating death... well, let's just say the final tally will be most intriguing. But as for your streak, my friend - I'm afraid it ends today. Your account is... overdue.

Ah, Detective Clausen. I see your account is... overdue. Perhaps we should settle this debt in our usual fashion - a roll of the dice. Though I must warn you, the winds of fate seem to be shifting. The newcomer has a habit of cheating death, and I suspect your luck may be running thin.
to see how the odds play out. After all, in this game of life and death, the house always wins - and I, dear Voss, am the house.

final tally.

As for your pathetic losing streak, I'm not surprised - with that mangled mug of yours, I'm surprised anyone can stomach looking at you long enough to place a bet. After all, I have a... bone to pick with you.

eternally in the red.
